The video above shows the incredibly emotional moment Chapecoense scored their first goal since the LaMia Flight 2933 air disaster in November. 
Last year, the entire football world was stunned after an aircraft carrying the Chapecoense senior team and staff crashed into a mountain in Colombia. Chapecoense were travelling take on Atletico Nacional in the Copa Sudamericana final. 
71 of the 77 passengers on board the plane were killed. 
The Brazilian side played their first game since the air disaster on Saturday - a friendly against league winners Palmeiras. Brazilian Chapecoense footballers Alan Ruschel (R) and Jackson Follmann (C), survivors of the LaMia airplane crash in Colombia (Photo: AFP/Getty) Relatives of players of Brazilian soccer team Chapecoense, who perished in a plane crash (Photo: Paulo Whitaker/Reuters) 
Prior to kick off, Chapecoense were presented with the Copa Sudamericana trophy which Atletico Nacional requested be awarded to the team following their loss. 
Goalkeeper Jackson Follmann, who survived the crash, lifted the trophy in front of an emotional crowd. Chapecoense's supporters cheer before a friendly football match against Palmeiras (Photo: AFP/Getty) 
After going 1-0 down, the home side levelled through Douglas Grolli - one of 17 players currently on loan at the Brazilian club. 
Chapecoense then went 2-1 up through Amaral - but they were denied a win when Vitor Carvalho equalised with 12 minutes to go. 
Chapecoense's new season will begin at home to Joinville on January 26. Like us on Facebook
